definition: to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: You don't just have to sit in the stands and gape at the exploits of others.
sentences.chinese: 你大可不必坐在看臺上，目瞪口呆地盯着別人的戰績。

sentences.english: When I heard that, I was aghast.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這裏，我真是目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: Then, however, something happened which made every mouth mute and every eye fixed.
sentences.chinese: 然而接下來，發生了一件讓每個人都目瞪口呆的事。

sentences.english: She stared at the brown stain that splotched the front of her dress.
sentences.chinese: 海茨帕因痛苦而目瞪口呆，瞅着她衣服前的污點。

sentences.english: She was sunned by the sudden news .
sentences.chinese: 她因聽到這突然的消息而目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: British journalist who happened to see the images this morning was appalled.
sentences.chinese: 一位英國記者碰巧看到這幅廣告，驚得目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: the girl for a few seconds.
sentences.chinese: 他目瞪口呆，盯了那女孩一會兒。

sentences.english: Lowered maximum duration for which Hirelings could be stunned.
sentences.chinese: 在持續時間中僱傭工能是目瞪口呆的降低最大。

sentences.english: Ron sits stunned, and the Howler smashes itself into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 羅恩目瞪口呆地坐着，吼叫信自動撕成碎片。

sentences.english: Selina would stare when she heard of it.
sentences.chinese: 賽麗娜聽說了，準會目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: When the facts first came out, I was stunned.
sentences.chinese: 事實真相第一次公佈出來的時候，我目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: The opportunities in China seem unbounded, making foreign investors starry-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 在中國機遇似乎是無限的，使外國投資者目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: The news stunned friends and relatives.
sentences.chinese: 漁民生還的消息讓他們的朋友和親戚驚得目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: I stood in the atrium's exact center and gaped.
sentences.chinese: 我站在中庭的正中央，目瞪口呆。
哈桑跟我目瞪口呆，愣住了。

sentences.english: Nick smoked and stared at the car dumbfounded, dazed.
sentences.chinese: 尼克抽着煙，盯着汽車目瞪口呆，一臉茫然。

definition: lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
tongue-tied/unable to speak (out of surprise, embarrassment etc)
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
